site_name: Land at Pudding Mill Lane and BridgewaterStratfordLondonE15
description: Formal Request for an Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA) Scoping Opinion under Regulation 15 of the Town and County Planning (Environmental Impact Assessment) (England and Wales) Regulations 2017 (as amended) in respect of outline planning applications (with one overarching Environmental Statement) for the redevelopment (including residential, commercial and community uses together with hard and soft landscaping works including the formation of new streets and the demolition of an existing bridge and construction of a new pedestrian and vehicular bridge) of the sites known as Pudding Mill Lane (which is located in a site bisected by Marshgate Lane and bounded by Pudding Mill River to the east, Barbers Road to the west, Highland Street to the west and the Pudding Mill River to the south) and Bridgewater (which is located in a site bounded by the Waterworks River to the east and to the south, the Greenway and the City Mill River to the west and by allotments and a railway to the north. The proposed Bridgewater development also includes a site at Warton Road, on the other side of the Waterworks River, in between the river and Warton Road).
